intro: Poissonia hypoleuca, commonly known as the white poissonia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers, which are borne on slender, branching inflorescences. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Poissonia hypoleuca thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
